isis.stitle: TSI 96-16-01 - Air Conditioning Compressor Clutch Coil Mounting Bolts

subjectgroup.subject: Air Conditioning Compressor Clutch Coil Mounting Bolts

geninfo.para: To improve the air conditioning clutch coil mounting on all vehicles with air conditioning built before December 30, 1995, Navistar has released a service kit that contains clutch coil mounting bolts that have an improved self-locking device. The kit also contains two clutch pulley mounting bolts and a hardened flat washer to be used with the pulley mounting bolt. If the clutch coil mounting bolts are loose, Navistar recommends that they be replaced with the bolts in this service kit.

note.para: It will not be possible to remove and install the clutch coil mounting bolts without removing the pulley because there is not enough clearance between the back of the pulley and the coil mounting plate.

step1.para: Remove the clutch coil mounting bolts.

important.para: Inspect the clutch coil mounting bolt holes to make sure the threads are not damaged or the holes elongated. If the clutch coil mounting bolt hole threads are damaged, the air conditioning compressor will have to be replaced. If the clutch coil mounting plate is bent or the mounting holes are elongated, the clutch coil will have to be replaced.

step1.para: Mount the clutch coil to the air conditioning compressor with the four self-locking bolts in the service kit. Tighten to 15 to 17 ft-lbs. (180 to 204 in-lbs.) (20 to 23 Nm).
Re-install the clutch pulley with one of the new pulley mounting bolts and the hardened flat washer from the service kit. Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 Nm).

note.para: The 1-1/2 inch bolt should be used with a V belt pulley and the 1-3/4 inch bolt should be used with a serpentine belt pulley.

step1.para: Install the belt and tension to 130 lbs. initially. Run the engine with the air conditioning system engaged. Retension the belt to 100 lbs. after initial belt wear in.
